result.execSummary:
The defendant Gene J. Cloud Sr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: of atty. fees for $703.68 to atty. Sacra
22 days credit

Defendant Gene J. Cloud in court with attorney Gregory W. Sacra.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Def. guilty.  Court imposes sentence.

Count 1:

$443.00 costs, 60 days to pay or set up a payment plan.
120 Days in Sauk County Jail, with huber, consecutive.  Commence on or before March 17, 2018, at 6:30 p.m.
Parties to provide jail credit, if appropriate
